setup.title: YouTube Live Setup
setup.templateDescription: Select settings from a past broadcast:
setup.noTemplatesHint: Your completed broadcasts from YouTube will appear here.
setup.usingTemplateHint: These settings have been applied. Use them as a reference when creating your broadcast in YouTube Studio.
setup.step1Description: Create a new live stream in YouTube Studio:
setup.step1Instruction2: Select 'Schedule stream' for a future broadcast
setup.step1Instruction3: Fill in the title, description, and thumbnail
setup.step2Description: Copy the stream key from your YouTube broadcast:
setup.step2Instruction1: In YouTube Studio, go to your scheduled stream
setup.step2Instruction2: Find 'Stream key' in the stream settings panel
setup.step2Instruction3: Click 'Copy' next to the stream key
setup.step2Note: Each broadcast uses the same stream key from your channel. You can find it under 'Stream Settings'.
setup.step3Description: Set up OBS Studio to stream to YouTube:
setup.step3Instruction3: Paste the stream key you copied
setup.step4Description: Choose the broadcast you created to stream to:
setup.noBroadcastsHint: Create a broadcast in YouTube Studio first, then refresh.
setup.tipDescription: Make sure to select the same broadcast you configured in YouTube Studio. The stream key connects OBS to your YouTube channel, and the broadcast selection tells the app which scheduled stream to use.

setup.title: OBS WebSocket Setup
setup.step1Description: OBS WebSocket is required for Church Hub to control OBS Studio. For OBS 28+, it's built-in. For older versions, download and install it:
setup.step2Instruction2: Go to Tools → WebSocket Server Settings
setup.step2Instruction3: Check "Enable WebSocket server" and set the password below
setup.step3Description: Copy this password and paste it in OBS WebSocket Server Settings:
setup.noteDescription: Make sure to use the same password in OBS. Church Hub will automatically use this password when connecting.

errors.obsNotRunning: Cannot connect to OBS. Make sure OBS is running and WebSocket server is enabled (Tools → WebSocket Server Settings).
errors.obsAuthFailed: OBS authentication failed. Check your WebSocket password in OBS settings.
errors.obsTimeout: Connection to OBS timed out. Check that the host and port are correct.
